comments:
I used to have (an old version of) UML2 Plugin running with older versions of 
Eclipse. With a new computer, i installeds Eclipse 2.1.2 and updated to 2.1.3. 
Then i installed the latest UML2 Plugin for this version 
(uml2_200401231430.zip), i.e. unzipped in main eclipse directory, restart 
Eclipse.

But when i try to create a model, there is no entry "UML2 Model" as shown in 
the "Getting Started With UML 2.0" Tutorial Figure 3.

I checked to have EMF 1.1 so my eclipse meets all requirements. I looked into 
the .log file and noticed the following entry, that does not come again, when i 
restart eclipse:

... i also tried starting eclipse with the args noted at
http://download.eclipse.org/tools/downloads/emf/scripts/downloads-all.php
but with no success ...  

the NullPointerException occurs in the log, when i try to lead a former model 
(.ead file) from my project with the EMF Generator.

The stack trace provided has to do with EMF, not UML2.

I tried this with eclipse-SDK-2.1.3-win32.zip, emf_1.1.1_20031120_1149WL.zip, 
xsd_1.1.1.1_20031120_1149WL.zip, uml2_200401231430.zip, and 
uml2.examples_200401231430.zip. Note that, strictly speaking, UML2 isn't 
supported on older versions of Eclipse and EMF since the first release is 
targeting Eclipse 3.0 and EMF 2.0.
